title: How to Create a Feminine Bedroom

steps.headline: Choose a feminine colour for your room.
steps.description: Try mixing lively (Purple, mauve, brown and red) with light colors (white, bright yellow, green and orange)

steps.headline: Choose floral designs for your bed sheets.
steps.description: Your bed will be the focal point of your feminine bedroom. So, dress it up. Lovely prints for bed sheets and pillows. But they should be in contrast to complement the room tone.

steps.headline: Have lots of throw pillows and bolsters on your bed, matching your sheets of course.
Get the softest sheets for your bed and a lovely warm comforter or a pretty pink blanket.
Fix a canopy of gossamer sheets or mosquito net over you bed for the princessy look.
steps.description: If you have the bed for it or you can build a frame, a canopy from a more solid, coordinating fabric can also have a very sophisticated look.

steps.headline: Create a reading nook.
steps.description: Fill it with your favorite books, a pen and notebook if you love to write or draw, and a chair you keep all to yourself.

steps.headline: Put up fairy lights for the soft feminine look when you're showing your feminine room to friends or even setting the mood to become Venus de Milo.
steps.description: If you can light them safely, candles also create a lovely, soft light, with sophisticated candle stand, with the statue of lady.

steps.headline: Add final touches like a fuzzy rug.
steps.description: A big mirror is a must for a lady, and if space provided it should be added with the dresser, having lots of storage space. and small divisions as ladies have many small things to keep. The vital things are perfume and moisturizer on the deck, a vase of pink roses (plastic is fine) and even a small basket full of aromatherapy stuff like scented candles and oils with burners.

text: Choose a feminine colour for your room. Try mixing lively (Purple, mauve, brown and red) with light colors (white, bright yellow, green and orange) Choose floral designs for your bed sheets. Your bed will be the focal point of your feminine bedroom. So, dress it up. Lovely prints for bed sheets and pillows. But they should be in contrast to complement the room tone. Have lots of throw pillows and bolsters on your bed, matching your sheets of course.  Get the softest sheets for your bed and a lovely warm comforter or a pretty pink blanket.  Fix a canopy of gossamer sheets or mosquito net over you bed for the princessy look. If you have the bed for it or you can build a frame, a canopy from a more solid, coordinating fabric can also have a very sophisticated look. Create a reading nook. Fill it with your favorite books, a pen and notebook if you love to write or draw, and a chair you keep all to yourself. Put up fairy lights for the soft feminine look when you're showing your feminine room to friends or even setting the mood to become Venus de Milo. If you can light them safely, candles also create a lovely, soft light, with sophisticated candle stand, with the statue of lady. Add final touches like a fuzzy rug. A big mirror is a must for a lady, and if space provided it should be added with the dresser, having lots of storage space. and small divisions as ladies have many small things to keep. The vital things are perfume and moisturizer on the deck, a vase of pink roses (plastic is fine) and even a small basket full of aromatherapy stuff like scented candles and oils with burners.
